intro: Callitris monticola, commonly known as the mountain cypress, is a species of coniferous tree native to Australia. It is characterized by its slender, tall trunk and dense, feathery foliage. The plant produces small, scale-like leaves arranged in flat sprays, typical of the Cupressaceae family. Its cones are woody and contain two to three seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This hardy species is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
